contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|brother}} A '''[[brother]]''' is a male sibling. '''Brother''' may also refer to: *[[Brother (Catholic)]], a member of a Catholic religious order *[[Friar]], a member of one of the mendicant orders *Brother, a title usually preceding a [[surname]] as a way to address a male parishioner in some Protestant church settings *Brother, a member of a [[Fraternities and sororities|fraternity]] *Brother, a term of address for a male member of the [[Rainbow Family]] *[[Brother Industries]], a Japanese manufacturing company *[[Brother (manga)|''Brother'' (manga)]], a Japanese manga *[[Brother Island (disambiguation)|Brother Island]], various islands around the world == Movies and television == *[[Brother (1997 film)|''Brother'' (1997 film)]], a Russian crime film *[[Brother (2000 film)|''Brother'' (2000 film)]], a Japanese film directed by Takeshi Kitano *Brother, a character from the TV series ''[[Berenstain Bears]]'' *[[Brothers (2004 film)|''Brothers'' (2004 film)]], a Danish film *[[Brothers (2009 film)|''Brothers'' (2009 film)]], an American remake of the Danish film ''Brothers'' (2004 film) == Music == *[[Brother (band)]], a Celtic-roots rock group from Australia * [[Brother (Canadian band)]], a rock band from Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada *[[Viva Brother]], a rock band from Slough, England that was originally called Brother *[[Brother (Boyzone album)|''Brother'' (Boyzone album)]], album by Irish boy band Boyzone *[[Brother (The Scene Aesthetic album)|''Brother'' (The Scene Aesthetic album)]] *[[Brother (Little Birdy song)|"Brother" (Little Birdy song)]] *[[Brothers (The Black Keys album)|''Brothers'' (The Black Keys album)]] *[[Brother Records]], the Beach Boys record label *[[Brother (Pearl Jam song)|"Brother" (Pearl Jam song)]] *[[Brother (Smashproof song)|"Brother" (Smashproof song)]], featuring Gin Wigmore *"Brother", a song by Alice in Chains from ''[[Sap (album)|Sap]]'' *"Brother", a song by Dark New Day from ''[[Twelve Year Silence]]'' *"Brother", a song by The Kinks from [[Sleepwalker (The Kinks album)|''Sleepwalker'' (The Kinks album)]] *"Brother", a song by [[Matt Corby]] *"Brother", a song by Murder by Death from ''[[In Bocca al Lupo]]'' *"Brother", a song by Stereophonics from ''[[Language. Sex. Violence. Other?]]'' *"Brother", a song by Steve Vai from ''[[Fire Garden]]'' ==See also== *[[African Americans]] *{{Lookfrom|Brother}} *[[Birth order]] {{Sibling (disambiguation)}} {{disambig}}
